q: "Every president has a challenge when it goes from campaigning to governing, takes a while to figure out the difference between campaign and governing," Colin Powell said on CNN's "State of the Union." Now we see at the end of the second year, he is definitely focusing on governing... we'll see how 2011 goes. Colin Powell , who worked in four presidential administrations- most recently under former President Bush - said he expects a strong economic message at the State of the Union address Tuesday. He said the electorate was expecting that focus

and the Philadelphia 76ers keep winning. One night after a 41-point effort in Philadelphia's most lopsided win of the season, Allen Iverson scored an NBA season-high and career-best 54 in a 107-103 victory over the James Cleveland Cavaliers. It was like he was playing horse tonight, said 76ers guard Aaron McKie , who had 20 points and nine assists. "His jumper was deadly." Using mostly jump shots, Allen Iverson went 20-of-30 from the field. He also hit 10-of-13 free-throw attempts en route

there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company." While Page and Sergey Brin founded the company, Eric Schmidt was brought in ten years ago to help manage the business side of Google. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed, Eric Schmidt wrote on his Twitter feed after the announcement. Now, Eric Schmidt said he will focus on deals, business relationships and working with governments, and still act "as an advisor to Larry and Sergey Brin

earned produces some unexpected results. A couple of months ago, when David Letterman introduced Bruce Willis on his show to promote the action-comedy movie Reds, the talk-show host declared in apparent amazement that Bruce Willis had earned more than$ 1.5-billion at the box office. But David Letterman 's researchers seriously low-balled Bruce Willis 's impact. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie. George Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie. The Congress did not lie. The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong, Donald Rumsfeld writes. the speech, given that Mr. Colin Powell will talk about it." Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Mr. Colin Powell objected. In his U.N. presentation, Mr. Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Mr. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian extremist who later led the Iraq branch of the al-Qaida terrorist network.
